intro: Senecio rahmeri var. rahmeri, commonly known as the Kahurangi Senecio, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It is typically found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
